section.title: Networking
section.para: &PB; uses the open-source NetworkManager to provide network management functionality in &BC;, which allows you to connect to other computers and to the internet. See the documentation of NetworkManager for more information about setting up networking using NetworkManager.

note.para: Whatever networks you setup in &BC; will be made available to all VMs, including the Wireless network which is shared between all VMs using Network Address Translation (NAT).

step.para: Click on the Network Manager icon and select Auto Ethernet.
Click the Network Manager icon.
Choose your preferred wireless network from the list and enter your security credentials.

In order to use wireless networks you will be ask to enter your own preferred security profile password. This profile password will protect all the wireless network credentials that you enter on &PB; from unauthorized access, and you will need to re-enter this password to connect to secure networks on subsequent reboots. You can optionally leave the password fields blank in which case the wireless credentials will not be protected.

procedure.title: To setup trusted boot using the Intel Trusted Platform Module (TPM) and Intel Trusted eXecution Technology (TXT), on an HP 6390p:

step.para: Install the correct firmware for the 6390p:
On a Windows machine, point your favourite webrowser at the BIOS update.
Click Download.
When the executable has downloaded, run it, accepting the default settings.
Navigate to C:\SWSetup\sp44150.
Run sp44150u.exe to create a bootable USB drive.
Accept the defaults and click Start.
Remove the USB drive or CD from the Windows machine and put it in a USB port on the target laptop.
Reboot the machine.
Press Esc and then F9.
In the Boot Options menu, select to boot from USB Hard Drive or CD.
Select Update and press Enter.
Press F10 to confirm.
Press any key on the keyboard twice to confirm.
Select Exit and press Enter.
Press F10.
Do not remove the USB stick or CD and wait for the machine to power down.
Power up the machine and wait for the BIOS to update.
When prompted, press Esc and then F10 to enter the BIOS Setup.
At this stage it is safe to remove the USB stick.
Select File > Restore Defaults.
Click Yes.

procedure.step:
The next stage involves correctly setting up the new BIOS:
Select System Configuration > Device Configuration.
Enable Virtualization Technology.
Ensure that SATA Device Mode is set to AHCI.
Save your settings and reboot your machine.

step.para: While the machine is rebooting, press Esc and then F10 to enter BIOS setup.
Select Security > Setup BIOS Administrator Password.
Enter a password twice to confirm it.
Click Security > TPM Embedded Security.
Enable Embedded Security Device State.
Enable OS Management of TPM.
Press Esc twice and select Yes to save your changes changes.
Press F1 to accept TPM activation.
